contentrichtext.text: '''Walter Bishop Sr.''' (January 9, 1905 – January 8, 1984) was a [[Jamaica]]n [[composer]] and [[songwriter]]. His ''Swing, Brother, Swing'' was recorded by [[Billie Holiday]] with [[Count Basie]], among other performers. His [[Calypso music|calypso]], ''Sex is a Misdemeanor'', continues to be recorded. Other songs written by Bishop, Sr. include, "Jack, You're Dead," which was a #1 R&B hit in 1947 as recorded by Louis Jordan; "The Stuff is Here (and It's Mellow);" and "Bop! Goes My Heart," which was recorded by Frank Sinatra. He was the father of American jazz pianist [[Walter Bishop, Jr.]] ==External links== *{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p56892|label=Walter Bishop, Sr.}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Bishop, Walter, Sr. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = January 9, 1905 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = January 8, 1984 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bishop, Walter, Sr.}} [[Category:1905 births]] [[Category:1984 deaths]] {{NorthAm-composer-stub}}
